meta.name: Convert Revit Projects to Database with Drawings & Specifications using DDC

parameters.formDescription: Configure your Revit file conversion settings

parameters.content:
## ‚ö†Ô∏è Troubleshooting

### Browser Popup Issues
If the form doesn't open:
1. Look for a popup blocker icon in your browser's address bar
2. Click it and select "Always allow popups from this site"
3. Refresh the page and try again

### Executable Path Issues
If conversion fails, ensure you're using the correct path:

‚úÖ **Correct path:**
```
C:\DDC_Converter_Revit\datadrivenlibs\RvtExporter.exe
```

‚ùå **Incorrect path:**
```
C:\Community\DDC_Converter_Revit\RvtExporter.exe

assignments.name: (optional) Add the BoundingBox geometry of each element in XLSX

parameters.content:
### Option 1: Manual Variables
- Click **"Manual Trigger"** to use pre-configured variables
- Modify the variables in the **"Set Variables"** node as needed

## üîß Configuration
- Update the **RvtExporter.exe** path in the form or variables
- Ensure the path points to the executable inside the **`datadrivenlibs`** folder

### Option 2: Form UI
- Activate and click **"Form UI"** to open the web form
- Fill in your converter path and Revit file path
- Select export mode and options

‚≠ê **If you find our tools helpful**, please **consider starring** our repository on [GitHub](https://github.com/datadrivenconstruction/cad2data-Revit-IFC-DWG-DGN-pipeline-with-conversion-validation-qto). 

Your support helps us improve and continue developing open solutions for the community!

nodes.name: Converting the project into a structured form1

parameters.content:
## üìã Options Parameter Configuration Guide

## üéØ Overview
The Options parameter allows you to customize the export process with various flags and settings. Multiple options can be combined using spaces.

## üöÄ Available Options

### üì¶ Export Modes
| Mode   | Description |
|------|-------------|
| `basic`   |  Minimal export with essential data only |
| `standard`   | Default export level with standard properties |
| `complete`   | Full export including all available data |
| `custom`   | Custom export using category file specification |

### üõ†Ô∏è Feature Flags
| Option | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| `bbox` | Add BoundingBox geometry of each element in XLSX |
| `schedule` | Export all Schedules |
| `sheets2pdf` | Export all Sheets to PDF format |
| `[<output file>]` | Specify custom output file path |
| `[<category file>]` | Text file with category names (required for custom mode) |

### üö´ Disable Options
| Option | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| `-no-xlsx` | Disable export to .xlsx format |
| `-no-collada` | Disable export to .dae format |

---

## üìù Notes
- All options are case-sensitive
- Invalid combinations will be ignored
- Default behavior applies when no options are specified
